SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

matrix
Class MatrixHelper

java.lang.Object
  matrix.MatrixHelper

public class MatrixHelper
extends java.lang.Object

Includes all the functions that were written to do matrix manipulation, many of which are written to simulate Matlab functions (i.e. randN(), randPerm()). I also wrote additional matrix manipulation and helper functions as well to fully implement the cosamp algorithm.

Version:
1.0 12/09/12
Author:
Jason Halpern

fillWithZeros

public static org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix fillWithZeros(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix zeroMatrix)
Fill an entire matrix with zeros. Does the same thing as MATLAB's zeros(m, n) function.

Parameters:
zeroMatrix - - the matrix that should be filled with zeros
Returns:
the matrix with all zero values

randomPermutation

public static org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix randomPermutation(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix randomMatrix)
Does the same thing as Matlab's randPerm(n) function. Returns a column vector containing a random permutation of the integers from 1 to the length of the signal inclusive.

Parameters:
randomMatrix - - contains all values between 1 and the length of the signal in a random order
Returns:
the column vector containing the random permutation of the numbers in the randomMatrix parameter

randN

public static org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix randN(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix randomMatrix)
Very similar to Matlab's randn(m, n) function

Parameters:
randomMatrix - - this matrix with be filled with Gaussian random numbers
Returns:
a matrix containing pseudorandom values drawn from the standard normal distribution.

setCellValues

public static org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix setCellValues(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix zeroMatrix,
                                                          org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix randomMatrix,
                                                          org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix gaussMatrix)
This function handles the following line from Matlab: x(v(1:K)) = randn(K,1). x is the zeroMatrix, v is our randomMatrix, the right side of the equation is the gaussMatrix.

Parameters:
zeroMatrix -
randomMatrix -
gaussMatrix -
Returns:
a matrix in which the cell numbers (determined by values in the random matrix) of the zero matrix are set to the values in the gaussMatrix.

copyMatrix

Create a copy of a matrix.

Parameters:
mtrx - - the matrix to be copied
Returns:
the new matrix that is identical to the parameter

norm

public static double norm(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix mtrx)
Similar to Matlab's norm() function. It squares each value in the matrix, adds those values together, then takes the square root of that sum.

Parameters:
mtrx -
Returns:
a value determined by squaring each value in the parameter matrix, adding those values together, then taking the square root of that sum.

fillColumn

public static org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix fillColumn(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix finalMatrix,
                                                       org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix currentMatrix,
                                                       int colNum)
Takes the values from the first column in currentMatrix and sets the values in the given column of the finalMatrix to those values.

Parameters:
finalMatrix - - a column in this matrix will be filled with values from currentMatrix
currentMatrix - - values from the first column of this matrix are retrieved and then set in the given column of finalMatrix.
colNum - - the column in finalMatrix that should be filled
Returns:
the new matrix with the modified column

toSingleColumn

public static org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix toSingleColumn(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix mtrx)
Converts the entire matrix to a single column. This basically works by stacking each subsequent column under the previous one until there is only a single column. Similar to the x = x(:) operation in Matlab.

Parameters:
mtrx - - the matrix that will be transformed into a single column vector
Returns:
the column vector

getAbsMatrix

public static org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix getAbsMatrix(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix mtrx)
Converts each element in the matrix to its absolute value. Similar to Matlab's abs(x) function.

Parameters:
mtrx - - will get the absolute values of this matrix
Returns:
a matrix with the absolute values of all the numbers in the parameter

sortDescending

public static java.util.List<org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix> sortDescending(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix mtrx)
Same at Matlab's sort(matrix, 'descending'). Sorts the elements in the specified direction, depending on the value of mode (i.e descending).

Parameters:
mtrx - - the matrix to be sorted
Returns:
a list with two matrices. The first matrix is the matrix with the sorted values. The second matrix includes the rows that the values were originally in before they were sorted.

notEqual

public static org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix notEqual(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix mtrx,
                                                     double testValue)
Check each cell in the matrix to see if it equals the test value. 1 if not equal, 0 if equal.

Parameters:
mtrx - - matrix with the values we are comparing to the test value
testValue - - the value that we are comparing to.
Returns:
a matrix that included the result from whether or not the values in the mtrx parameter equal the testValue.

Returns:

getIndices

public static org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix getIndices(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix mtrx,
                                                       org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix indexMatrix)
Loop through the index matrix to get a specific index, then grab the value at that index from the matrix.

Parameters:
mtrx - - matrix that we are obtaining values from.
indexMatrix - - all the indices that we need to obtain from mtrx.
Returns:
a new matrix that includes all the values at the indices mentioned.

findNonzero

public static org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix findNonzero(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix equalityMtrx)
Similar to Matlab's find(x) function. Locates all nonzero elements of array X, and returns the linear indices of those elements. If X is a row vector, then the returned tempMtrx is a row vector; otherwise, it is a column vector.

Parameters:
equalityMtrx -
Returns:
the matrix that indicates the nonzero elements of the equalityMatrix.

union

public static org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix union(org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix findMatrix,
                                                  org.apache.mahout.math.Matrix indiceMatrix)
Union of two matrices. Doesn't include dupes.

Parameters:
findMatrix - - the first matrix in the union
indiceMatrix - - the second matrix in the union
Returns:
a matrix that is the union of the two parameters.

Find the length of a matrix. This is the max of either the row length or column length.

Parameters:
mtrx - - calculate the square root of all values in this matrix.
